metadata.title: CVE-2014-8631 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The Chrome Object Wrapper (COW) implementation in Mozilla Firefox before34.0 and SeaMonkey before 2.31 supports native-interface passing, whichallows remote attackers to bypass intended DOM object restrictions via acall to an unspecified method.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8631` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 34.0
firefox-globalmenu - 34.0
firefox-mozsymbols - 34.0
firefox-testsuite - 34.0
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '34.0').
